tn.ref: for my salvation is near, and my righteousness is about to be revealed.
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will soon save you and show you that I am righteous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "holds it tightly" is an idiom that means to continue to observe something. AT: "who is careful to always do this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: keeps his hand from doing any evil
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to the person's actions or behaviors. AT: "does not do evil things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: See, I am a dry tree
tn.text: This means eunuchs may have thought they could not be a part of God's people because they were deformed by castration (and for this reason could not have children). Israelites did not practice castration; foreigners did, sometimes for punishment. Eunuchs who had accepted the Hebrew faith knew that normally they were not allowed to worship in the temple (Deut. 23:1). The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: in my house and within my walls
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing. AT: "inside the walls of my temple" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: that will never be cut off
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that will never end" or "that will never be forgotten" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to foreigners who have joined Yahweh's people.

tn.ref: who love the name of Yahweh
tn.text: "name" represents the reputation and person of Yahweh. AT: "who love Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: will be accepted on my altar
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will accept on my altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: my house will be called a house of prayer
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "my house will be a house of prayer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: All you wild beasts of the field, come and devour, all you beasts in the forest
tn.text: God is calling armies of other nations by comparing them to animals to come and attack the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This means Israel's leaders cannot or perhaps do not want to see what is going on in society.
The leaders are supposed to open their mouths and warn the people, but they do not. Comparing someone to a dog in this society is a great insult. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: They dream, and lying down they love to sleep
tn.text: This means the leaders are not bringing God's word of warning to Israel but prefer their own comfort.
Yahweh continues describing the evil leaders of his people.
Yahweh continues comparing Israel's bad leaders to dogs. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
